cell.html: First prime-time Thanksgiving game in NFL history held in the request of Chiefs owner Lamar Hunt, whom had asked the NFL to schedule a third game for years. At the time of the game, Hunt was hospitalized in Dallas, Texas, and died weeks later at the age of 74.
cell.text: First prime-time Thanksgiving game in NFL history held in the request of Chiefs owner Lamar Hunt, whom had asked the NFL to schedule a third game for years. At the time of the game, Hunt was hospitalized in Dallas, Texas, and died weeks later at the age of 74.

cell.html: Unsafe weather conditions and rain storm delay game by twenty minutes.
cell.text: Unsafe weather conditions and rain storm delay game by twenty minutes.

cell.html: After the Cowboys-Falcons game, Cowboys wide receiver Terrell Owens came to the NFL Total Access set and acknowledged spitting in the face of Falcons' cornerback DeAngelo Hall early in the contest. There is no video, from that night's telecast or any other source, that is known to have captured the incident, but Owens was fined $30,000 by the NFL.
cell.text: After the Cowboys-Falcons game, Cowboys wide receiver Terrell Owens came to the NFL Total Access set and acknowledged spitting in the face of Falcons' cornerback DeAngelo Hall early in the contest. There is no video, from that night's telecast or any other source, that is known to have captured the incident, but Owens was fined $30,000 by the NFL.

cell.html: Sideline reporter Adam Schefter reported that the Oakland Raiders had begun the process to fire head coach Art Shell , which was immediately refuted by Al Davis . Weeks later, the report was true and the Raiders indeed relieved Shell of his duties.
cell.text: Sideline reporter Adam Schefter reported that the Oakland Raiders had begun the process to fire head coach Art Shell , which was immediately refuted by Al Davis . Weeks later, the report was true and the Raiders indeed relieved Shell of his duties.

context.text: NFL Network Run to the Playoffs results (2006-present) - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Day Date Visiting Team Final Score Host Team Stadium Game Notes
[ edit ] 2006 NFL season Main article: 2006 NFL season
NFL Network Run to the Playoffs results (2006-present)
[ edit ] 2006 notes and Nielsen ratings
[ edit ] Results by season
[ edit ] See also
[ edit ] References
Contents
Listed below are games and their respective results played from 2006 present .
[ edit ] Results by season

According to Nielsen Media Research , the Broncos-Chiefs game that opened this package was the highest-rated program on cable/satellite TV in the United States on November 23 , 2006 , with a 6.8 rating (among available households) and an average of 4.2 million households. These numbers are especially remarkable, considering that millions of potential fans were unable to see the game due to their cable systems not making it available to them.
Contents

Starting with the 2006 NFL season , NFL Network was awarded the rights to air Thursday and Saturday night prime time American football games. Previously, games played on Thursdays and Saturdays were broadcast on TNT and ESPN .
The following is a detailed list of results and scores from National Football League games aired on NFL Network's Run to the Playoffs .

Media Life magazine reported the second Thursday night game, Ravens/Bengals, dropped to 2.9 million households. Further numbers for Thursday night games were not reported, as they have not ranked in the weekly Top 25 lists for cable programming.
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
NFL Network Run to the Playoffs results (2006-present)
Overtime Result
The Cowboys/Falcons game attracted 2.9 million households, placing it seventh for the week among cable broadcasts.
